page.title: 05A Warsop Benefactor.
page.content: {Sir John Bealby Eastwood. Adam Eastwood came to Warsop in 1866 and began a building firm.His son William continued the business. William's son John was born in 1909.He went to Hett's Lane Infants' School, Burns Lane School and Queen Elizabeth's Boys' Grammar School before joining the family firm, which became known as W.&J.B.Eastwood. Eastwood buildings include local churches,schools,cinemas and inns. John Bealby Eastwood received a knighthood in 1975. Sir John extended the business into farming and,in particular,eggs and poultry.When the latter interests were sold off the money was put into a charitable foundation.From this wealth local schools,hospitals,churches and the handicapped have all benefited.
